verb.description: Taste (good food or drink) and enjoy it completely.
examples: gourmets will want to savor our game specialties

verb.description: Have a suggestion or trace of (something, especially something bad)
examples: their genuflections savored of superstition and popery

noun.description: A characteristic taste, flavor, or smell, especially a pleasant one.
examples: the subtle savor of wood smoke

origin: Middle English: from Old French, from Latin sapor, from sapere to taste.
